thread.title: What If Off-Duty Employees Unplugged?

author: Mike Vilensky
title: What If Off-Duty Employees Unplugged?
text:
New Yorkers are used to having their happy hours interrupted with emails or calls from the boss.
But a new proposal being floated in the City Council could give them the right to hit ignore.
A measure protecting private-sector employees from penalties for ignoring after-hours or weekend work communications is gaining steam among New York Democrats,...
